meanings.definition: The number of bonds an atom can form with other atoms.
meanings.sent1: The valency of oxygen is two, meaning it can form two bonds.
meanings.sent2: Carbon's valency of four allows it to form strong bonds with other elements.
meanings.sent3: When hydrogen and oxygen meet, their valency creates a powerful bond.
meanings.sent4: In the dance of molecules, valency determines who partners up with whom.
meanings.sent5: The valency of nitrogen makes it a versatile player in the chemical world.

meanings.definition: The combining power of an element.
meanings.sent1: The valency of sodium is one, making it highly reactive.
meanings.sent2: Chlorine's valency of one allows it to easily combine with other elements.
meanings.sent3: The valency of elements is like their social skills - some are more outgoing than others.
meanings.sent4: In the kitchen of chemistry, valency is the chef that mixes the elements together.
meanings.sent5: Understanding valency is key to predicting how elements will interact in a reaction.
